lead_paragraph: Ardizoia, 95, a pitcher who appeared in just one major league game, attended Joe DiMaggio’s wedding, gave a helping hand to Babe Ruth and spent a season playing for Casey Stengel in the minors.

headline.main: Rinaldo Ardizoia, the Oldest Living Yankee, Reflects on His Career

snippet: Ardizoia, 95, a pitcher who appeared in just one major league game, attended Joe DiMaggio’s wedding, gave a helping hand to Babe Ruth and spent a season playing for Casey Stengel in the minors.
abstract: Profile of Rinaldo Ardizoia, who at age 95 is the oldest-living former member of the New York Yankees; was one of team's top pitching prospects in the early 1940s before his career was interrupted by World War II; played in only one major league game, but has fascinating stories about interactions with Babe Ruth, Joe DiMaggio and others.
